intro: Argythamnia sellowiana, commonly known as the Sellow's argythamnia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. It has small, linear leaves and produces seeds in a distinctive involucral structure. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects in its native habitat.
